Configuration.Sql:
BEGIN TRAN -- RelaxConstraints: disable specific foreign key constraints ALTER TABLE FormInputSingleSelectValue NOCHECK CONSTRAINT FK_FormInputSingleSelectValue#SelectedOption# -- FK_FormInputSingleSelectValue#SelectedOption# ALTER TABLE FormTemplateInputItem NOCHECK CONSTRAINT FK_FormTemplateInputItem#ShowIfOption# -- FK_FormTemplateInputItem#ShowIfOption# ALTER TABLE FormTemplate NOCHECK CONSTRAINT FK_FormTemplate#LastModifiedUser# -- FK_FormTemplate#LastModifiedUser# set nocount on IF EXISTS (SELECT * FROM dbo.sysindexes WHERE id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[PrgItemDef]') AND name = N'UN_PrgItemDef_Name') ALTER TABLE [dbo].[PrgItemDef] DROP CONSTRAINT [UN_PrgItemDef_Name] IF EXISTS (SELECT * FROM dbo.sysindexes WHERE id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[ProgramDocTranslatedText]') AND name = N'UN_ProgramDocTranslatedText_Text') ALTER TABLE [dbo].[ProgramDocTranslatedText] DROP CONSTRAINT [UN_ProgramDocTranslatedText_Text] -- Declare a temporary table to hold the data to be synchronized DECLARE @FormTemplate TABLE (Id uniqueidentifier, Name varchar(50), TypeId uniqueidentifier, IntervalSeriesId uniqueidentifier, PageLength float, ProgramID uniqueidentifier, Code varchar(50), LastModifiedDate datetime, LastModifiedUserID uniqueidentifier) -- Insert the data to be synchronized into the temporary table INSERT INTO @FormTemplate VALUES ('9c0ba64e-c848-42f4-9a16-b9b6d37ca85c', N'Converted - Assessments', 'f4e41948-74c0-4bb5-b218-f2437c7b040b', '6e839019-46cc-4246-bb42-5ca42ed4ae6b', 11, 'f98a8ef2-98e2-4cac-95af-d7d89ef7f80c', N'ConvAssess', '9/18/2014 8:43:41 PM', 'eee133bd-c557-47e1-ab67-ee413dd3d1ab') INSERT INTO @FormTemplate VALUES ('876cf1e1-2e04-4f96-b15c-cb4b9d305ff9', N'Accommodations/Modifications', 'f4e41948-74c0-4bb5-b218-f2437c7b040b', '6e839019-46cc-4246-bb42-5ca42ed4ae6b', 11, 'f98a8ef2-98e2-4cac-95af-d7d89ef7f80c', N'AccomsMods', '9/10/2014 4:55:10 PM', '57eb6953-193e-4846-9a20-145fc5941d5f') -- Declare a temporary table to hold the data to be synchronized DECLARE @PrgSectionDef TABLE (ID uniqueidentifier, TypeID uniqueidentifier, ItemDefID uniqueidentifier, Sequence int, IsVersioned bit, Code varchar(50), Title varchar(50), VideoUrl varchar(200), HelpTextLegal text, HelpTextInfo text, FormTemplateID uniqueidentifier, DisplayPrevious bit, CanCopy bit, HeaderFormTemplateID uniqueidentifier, HelpTextState text) -- Insert the data to be synchronized into the temporary table INSERT INTO @PrgSectionDef VALUES ('82afde84-49c0-45d0-b13e-201151ce90cc', '6f3f1c06-64c6-4c70-a834-0941accd0f62', '1984f017-51cb-4e3c-9b3a-338a9d409ec6', 6, 1, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0, 0, '9c0ba64e-c848-42f4-9a16-b9b6d37ca85c', N'
  • NAEP 2015 Accommodations Guidelines
  • Schedule of NAEP Assessments
') INSERT INTO @PrgSectionDef VALUES ('43cd5045-8083-4534-ad66-a81c43a42f26', '265ac4ec-2325-4ca8-a428-5361dc7f83f0', '1984f017-51cb-4e3c-9b3a-338a9d409ec6', 4, 1, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, '876cf1e1-2e04-4f96-b15c-cb4b9d305ff9', 0, 0, NULL, NULL) -- Declare a temporary table to hold the data to be synchronized DECLARE @IepAccommodationsSectionDef TABLE (ID uniqueidentifier, TrackDetails bit, TrackForAssessments bit, UseDetails bit) -- Insert the data to be synchronized into the temporary table INSERT INTO @IepAccommodationsSectionDef VALUES ('43cd5045-8083-4534-ad66-a81c43a42f26', 0, 0, 0) -- Declare a temporary table to hold the data to be synchronized DECLARE @IepAssessmentsSectionDef TABLE (ID uniqueidentifier, UseBooleanParticipation bit) -- Insert the data to be synchronized into the temporary table INSERT INTO @IepAssessmentsSectionDef VALUES ('82afde84-49c0-45d0-b13e-201151ce90cc', 0) -- Insert records in the destination tables that do not already exist INSERT INTO FormTemplate (Id, Name, TypeId, IntervalSeriesId, PageLength, ProgramID, Code, LastModifiedDate, LastModifiedUserID) SELECT Source.* FROM @FormTemplate Source LEFT JOIN FormTemplate Destination ON Source.Id = Destination.Id WHERE Destination.Id IS NULL INSERT INTO PrgSectionDef (ID, TypeID, ItemDefID, Sequence, IsVersioned, Code, Title, VideoUrl, HelpTextLegal, HelpTextInfo, FormTemplateID, DisplayPrevious, CanCopy, HeaderFormTemplateID, HelpTextState) SELECT Source.* FROM @PrgSectionDef Source LEFT JOIN PrgSectionDef Destination ON Source.ID = Destination.ID WHERE Destination.ID IS NULL INSERT INTO IepAccommodationsSectionDef (ID, TrackDetails, TrackForAssessments, UseDetails) SELECT Source.* FROM @IepAccommodationsSectionDef Source LEFT JOIN IepAccommodationsSectionDef Destination ON Source.ID = Destination.ID WHERE Destination.ID IS NULL INSERT INTO IepAssessmentsSectionDef (ID, UseBooleanParticipation) SELECT Source.* FROM @IepAssessmentsSectionDef Source LEFT JOIN IepAssessmentsSectionDef Destination ON Source.ID = Destination.ID WHERE Destination.ID IS NULL -- Update records in the destination table that already exist UPDATE Destination SET Destination.Name = Source.Name, Destination.TypeId = Source.TypeId, Destination.IntervalSeriesId = Source.IntervalSeriesId, Destination.PageLength = Source.PageLength, Destination.ProgramID = Source.ProgramID, Destination.Code = Source.Code, Destination.LastModifiedDate = Source.LastModifiedDate, Destination.LastModifiedUserID = Source.LastModifiedUserID FROM @FormTemplate Source JOIN FormTemplate Destination ON Source.Id = Destination.Id UPDATE Destination SET Destination.TypeID = Source.TypeID, Destination.ItemDefID = Source.ItemDefID, Destination.Sequence = Source.Sequence, Destination.IsVersioned = Source.IsVersioned, Destination.Code = Source.Code, Destination.Title = Source.Title, Destination.VideoUrl = Source.VideoUrl, Destination.HelpTextLegal = Source.HelpTextLegal, Destination.HelpTextInfo = Source.HelpTextInfo, Destination.FormTemplateID = Source.FormTemplateID, Destination.DisplayPrevious = Source.DisplayPrevious, Destination.CanCopy = Source.CanCopy, Destination.HeaderFormTemplateID = Source.HeaderFormTemplateID, Destination.HelpTextState = Source.HelpTextState FROM @PrgSectionDef Source JOIN PrgSectionDef Destination ON Source.ID = Destination.ID UPDATE Destination SET Destination.TrackDetails = Source.TrackDetails, Destination.TrackForAssessments = Source.TrackForAssessments, Destination.UseDetails = Source.UseDetails FROM @IepAccommodationsSectionDef Source JOIN IepAccommodationsSectionDef Destination ON Source.ID = Destination.ID UPDATE Destination SET Destination.UseBooleanParticipation = Source.UseBooleanParticipation FROM @IepAssessmentsSectionDef Source JOIN IepAssessmentsSectionDef Destination ON Source.ID = Destination.ID -- Delete records in the destination tables that are obsolete DELETE FROM Destination FROM IepAssessmentsSectionDef Destination JOIN (SELECT * FROM IepAssessmentsSectionDef WHERE ID = '82AFDE84-49C0-45D0-B13E-201151CE90CC') Filtered ON Destination.ID = Filtered.ID LEFT JOIN @IepAssessmentsSectionDef Source ON Destination.ID = Source.ID WHERE Source.ID IS NULL DELETE FROM Destination FROM IepAccommodationsSectionDef Destination JOIN (SELECT * FROM IepAccommodationsSectionDef WHERE ID = '43CD5045-8083-4534-AD66-A81C43A42F26') Filtered ON Destination.ID = Filtered.ID LEFT JOIN @IepAccommodationsSectionDef Source ON Destination.ID = Source.ID WHERE Source.ID IS NULL DELETE FROM Destination FROM PrgSectionDef Destination JOIN (SELECT * FROM PrgSectionDef WHERE ID in ('43CD5045-8083-4534-AD66-A81C43A42F26', '82AFDE84-49C0-45D0-B13E-201151CE90CC')) Filtered ON Destination.ID = Filtered.ID LEFT JOIN @PrgSectionDef Source ON Destination.ID = Source.ID WHERE Source.ID IS NULL DELETE FROM Destination FROM FormTemplate Destination JOIN (SELECT * FROM FormTemplate WHERE ID in ('876CF1E1-2E04-4F96-B15C-CB4B9D305FF9', '9C0BA64E-C848-42F4-9A16-B9B6D37CA85C')) Filtered ON Destination.Id = Filtered.Id LEFT JOIN @FormTemplate Source ON Destination.Id = Source.Id WHERE Source.Id IS NULL set nocount off -- update PrgItemDef.LastModifiedUserID for users that don't exist UPDATE i SET LastModifiedUserID = 'EEE133BD-C557-47E1-AB67-EE413DD3D1AB' FROM PrgItemDef i LEFT JOIN UserProfile u ON i.LastModifiedUserID = u.ID WHERE u.ID IS NULL -- update FormTemplate.LastModifiedUserID for users that don't exist UPDATE f SET LastModifiedUserID = 'EEE133BD-C557-47E1-AB67-EE413DD3D1AB' FROM FormTemplate f LEFT JOIN UserProfile u ON f.LastModifiedUserID = u.ID WHERE u.ID IS NULL ALTER TABLE [dbo].[PrgItemDef] ADD CONSTRAINT [UN_PrgItemDef_Name] UNIQUE NONCLUSTERED ( [ProgramID] ASC, [Name] ASC, [DeletedDate] ASC ) ON [PRIMARY] ALTER TABLE [dbo].[ProgramDocTranslatedText] ADD CONSTRAINT [UN_ProgramDocTranslatedText_Text] UNIQUE ( [TranslationLanguageID], [DocTextID] ) DELETE m FROM PrgMilestone m JOIN PrgMilestoneDef d on m.MilestoneDefID = d.ID WHERE d.DeletedDate IS NOT NULL AND m.DateMet IS NULL UPDATE PrgMilestoneDef SET IsReevaluationNeeded=1, IsExternallyModified=1 WHERE DefinedByTemplate = 1 -- RelaxConstraints: perform cleanup operations UPDATE FormInputSingleSelectValue SET SelectedOptionId = NULL WHERE SelectedOptionId IS NOT NULL AND SelectedOptionId NOT IN (SELECT ID FROM FormTemplateInputSelectFieldOption) -- FK_FormInputSingleSelectValue#SelectedOption# -- no resolution -- FK_FormTemplateInputItem#ShowIfOption# -- no resolution -- FK_FormTemplate#LastModifiedUser# -- RelaxConstraints: re-enable specific foreign key constraints ALTER TABLE FormInputSingleSelectValue WITH CHECK CHECK CONSTRAINT FK_FormInputSingleSelectValue#SelectedOption# -- FK_FormInputSingleSelectValue#SelectedOption# ALTER TABLE FormTemplateInputItem WITH CHECK CHECK CONSTRAINT FK_FormTemplateInputItem#ShowIfOption# -- FK_FormTemplateInputItem#ShowIfOption# ALTER TABLE FormTemplate WITH CHECK CHECK CONSTRAINT FK_FormTemplate#LastModifiedUser# -- FK_FormTemplate#LastModifiedUser# COMMIT TRAN

FlagField.Label: Modifications necessary?

TextField.Label: Identify and Define the Target Behavior:
Baseline Data for Target Behavior (frequency, intensity, duration, etc.):

SingleSelectField.Label: Identify the function of the Target Behavior:

TextField.Label: Replacement Behavior: (Behavior that could meet the same function/need as the Target Behavior):
Describe the skills to be taught related to Replacement Behavior:
Strategies that will be used to support and reinforce replacement behavior:

FlagField.Label: Is a crisis plan necessary?

TextField.Label: How will regular communication about the Behavioral Intervention Plan take place among staff involved in the implementation?

MultiSelectField.Label: How will parent/guardian be consistently informed of progress?

div.style: border: 1px solid #EEE; background-color: #F7FAF9; font-size: 8pt; font-color: #AAADAD; padding: 10px;

em.strong:
To answer the questions below, think about the child's functioning in these and closely related areas (as indicated by assessments and based on observations from individuals in close contact with the child):
Relating with adults
Relating with other children
Following rules related to groups or interacting with others (if older than 18 months)

SingleSelectField.Label: a. To what extent does this child show age-appropriated functioning, across a variety of settings and situations, on this outcome:

FlagField.Label: b. Has the child shown any new skills or behaviors related to positive social-emotional skills (including positive social relationships) since the last outcomes summary?

Section.Label: 2. Acquiring and Using Knowledge and Skills

div.style: border: 1px solid #EEE; background-color: #F7FAF9; font-size: 8pt; font-color: #AAADAD; padding: 10px;

em.strong:
To answer the questions below, think about the child's functioning in these and closely related areas (as indicated by assessments and based on observations from individuals in close contact with the child):
Thinking, reasoning, remembering and problem solving
Understanding symbols
Understanding the physical and social worlds

SingleSelectField.Label: a. To what extent does this child show age-appropriate functioning, across a variety of settings and situations, on this outcome:

FlagField.Label: b. Has the child shown any new skills or behaviors related to acquiring and using knowledge and skills since the last outcomes summary?

Section.Label: 3. Taking Appropriate Action to Meet Needs

div.style: border: 1px solid #EEE; background-color: #F7FAF9; font-size: 8pt; font-color: #AAADAD; padding: 10px;

em.strong:
To answer the questions below, think about the child's functioning in these and closely related areas (as indicated by assessments and based on observations from individuals in close contact with the child):
Taking care of basic needs (e.g., showing hunger, dressing, feeding, toileting, etc.)
Contributing to own health and safety (e.g., follows rules, assists with hand washing, avoids inedible objects) (if older than 24 months)
Getting from place to place (mobility) and using tools (e.g., forks, strings attached to objects)

SingleSelectField.Label: a. To what extent does this child show age-appropriate functioning, across a variety of settings and situations, on this outcome:

FlagField.Label: b. Has the child shown any new skills or behaviors related to taking appropriate actions to meet needs since the last outcomes summary?

MultiSelectField.Label: Family information on child functioning: (check all that apply)

InputArea.Label: Please indicate the areas that will be evaluated:

FlagField.Label: Health
Educational
Psychological
Social Developmental History
Behavioral/Emotional
Speech / Language / Communication
Observations
Motor
Adaptive Behavior
Vocational Evaluation
FBA
Other

TextField.Label: Please provide information on the evaluation

Template.Name: Consent for Initial Provision of Services

Section.Label: Return Consent for Initial Provision of Services to:

TextField.Label: Content (include participants, purpose of contact, what transpired, and outcome)

Option.Label: Use existing BIP (print from View History)

TextField.Label: Explain why the student will not participate in district assessments.

InputArea.Label: Check the activities where the student will not participate with nondisabled students:

TextField.Label: Describe any specific directions relating to the student's placement or the delivery of instruction and services:

InputArea.Label: Communication Evaluation (includes but is not limited to measures of language, semantics, and pragmatics)
Behavioral Assessment related to Autism Spectrum Disorder

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?
MUST demonstrate impairment in at least three of the four areas:

TextField.Label: 4. Restricted, repetitive, or stereotypic patterns of behavior, interests, and/or activities
What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

Template.Name: ED: Deaf and Hard of Hearing

InputArea.Label: Communication Evaluation including receptive, expressive, and augmentative communication skills
Audiological/Otological Evaluation (including air conduction, bone conduction, and speech reception testing with and without amplification, and impedance testing)

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?

TextField.Label: What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

InputArea.Label: Medical Evaluation including documentation of etiology and prognosis of condition

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?

TextField.Label: 1. Visual impairment in combination with hearing impairment
2. Severe communication, developmental and educational needs
3. Needs cannot be met in a program designed solely for visually impaired or hearing impaired:
What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

InputArea.Label: Psychological Evaluation (including physical, cognitive, communication and social/emotional measures)

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?

TextField.Label: A. Delayed/Atypical Development in one or more of the following areas: physical, cognitive, communication, social/emotional, or adaptive: (30% delay in an assessment that yields scores in months or 2 or more standard deviations below the mean on standardized tests in one area; or 25% delay in an assessment that yields scores in months or 1.5 or more standard deviations below the mean on standardized tests in two or more areas.)

B. Delayed/Atypical behavior(s) that is so significantly inadequate or inappropriate that it interferes with the child's ability to learn and/or cope with normal situational or environmental demands. Must be evidenced that the patterns of behavior occur in more than one setting over an extended period of time.
What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

InputArea.Label: Psychological Evaluation (to include appropriate behavioral/emotional and personality measures)
Behavioral/Emotional Evaluation (which may include a behavioral/emotional skill rating)
Behavioral Intervention Plan with Progress Monitoring

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?

TextField.Label: An inability to make educational progress that cannot be explained by intellectual, sensory, or health factors:
An inability to build or maintain satisfactory interpersonal relationships with peers and teachers:
Inappropriate types of behaviors or feelings under normal circumstances:
A general pervasive mood of unhappiness or depression:
A tendency to develop physical symptoms or fears associated with personal or school problems:
What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?
Document information for the following areas:

SingleSelectField.Label: Intellectual functioning at one of the following levels on an individually administered standardized intelligence test:

Option.Label: Mild: two standard deviations below the mean plus or minus the standard error of measure
Moderate: three standard deviations below the mean plus or minus the standard error of measure
Severe: four or more standard deviations below the mean plus or minus the standard error of measure

SingleSelectField.Label: Adaptive behavior deficits at or below:

Option.Label: two standard deviations below the mean in one domain
one and one-half standard deviations below the mean in two or more domains

TextField.Label: What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?
Document information for the following areas:

TextField.Label: 1. Two or more disabilities occurring together
2. Severity and complexity of educational needs is such that they cannot be accommodated in a program solely for one of the disabilities:
What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

InputArea.Label: Summary of conference with parent(s) or documentation of attempts to conference

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?
Document information for the following area:

TextField.Label: What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?
A chronic or acute health problem along with one or more of the following:

TextField.Label: Limited alertness, including heightened alertness to environmental stimuli that results in limited alertness with respect to the educational environment
What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

InputArea.Label: Research based interventions to address academic skill deficiencies (progress monitoring data)
Academic, Functional and Behavioral Observations across settings

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?
Based on information from multiple sources, provide documentation of significant delays in the following:

MultiSelectField.Label: The child does not achieve adequately for the child's age, intellectual development or to meet State-approved grade-level standards in one or more of the following areas when provided with learning experiences and instruction appropriate for the child’s age or State-approved grade level-standards:

InputArea.Label: Method of Eligibility (Select one of the following):

FlagField.Label: The child does not make sufficient progress to meet age or State-approved grade-level standards in one or more of the areas identified above when using a process based on the child’s response to scientific, research-based intervention; OR

TextField.Label: Explain (give specific examples to show evidence of insufficient progress)

FlagField.Label: The child exhibits a pattern of strengths and weaknesses in performance, achievement, or both, relative to age, State-approved grade-level standards or intellectual development, that is determined by the group to be relevant to the identification of a specific learning disability, using appropriate assessments; OR

TextField.Label: Explain (pattern of strengths and weaknesses in performance, achievement, or both)

FlagField.Label: The child does not meet requirements under either method (not eligible)

The following factors have been ruled out as the primary cause of the disability: sensory or motor deficits, intellectual or serious emotional disabilities, Limited English proficiency, environmental, cultural, or economic influences, or lack of appropriate instruction in reading or math.

MultiSelectField.Label: Select the factors that could not be ruled out:

Option.Label: lack of appropriate instruction in reading or math

TextField.Label: What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

InputArea.Label: One of the following evaluations, based on screening results, individualized to address the specific area(s) of concern:

FlagField.Label: Articulation
Fluency
Language (including form, content, and function)
Voice/resonance
Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?
One or more of the following areas:

TextField.Label: Articulation-Two or more phonemic errors and/or phonological processes not expected at the child’s age or developmental level

Language-Standard scores on an evaluation instrument suggest a language disorder and /or non-standardized/informal assessment indicates that the child has difficulty understanding and or expressing ideas and/or concepts (language)
Voice-Demonstration of consistent deviations in vocal production that are inappropriate for chronological/mental age, gender, and ability
What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

Section.Label: Screenings and Evaluations
Section.Text: Note: Screenings listed below may be waived for students who have been medically diagnosed with traumatic brain injury and who have received medical and/or rehabilitative services in a medical or rehabilitation program or setting within the previous twelve months.

InputArea.Label: Review of educational history and records
Summary of conference with parent(s) or documentation of attempts to conference
Academic, Functional and Behavioral Observations across settings
Psychological Evaluation which is current within one year and is conducted by a qualified professional

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?
Document information for the following area:

TextField.Label: Written verification of traumatic brain injury (e.g., that the child has sustained an injury from which brain injury can be inferred) by a licensed physician or licensed psychologist (appropriately practicing in the specialty of neuropsychology). No time limits exist for written verification.
What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

Section.Label: Screenings and Evaluations

InputArea.Label: Summary of conference with parent(s) or documentation of attempts to conference
FOR SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN: Academic, Functional and Behavioral Observations across settings (address expanded core curriculum)
Braille Skills Inventory and/or Learning Media Assessment

FlagField.Label: Needed?

InputArea.Label: As a result of the required screenings, evaluations, and review of existing information, what do we now know about the student?

TextField.Label: Visual acuity between 20/70 and 20/200 in the better eye after correction

Visual acuity of 20/200 or less in the better eye after correction or a peripheral field so contracted that the widest diameter subtends an arc no greater than 20 degrees to be considered legally blind
What is the adverse effect of the disability on educational and/or functional performance of the child?
What evidence exists that the student requires specially designed instruction?

FlagField.Label: Does the student meet the eligibility criteria for special education services under SC State Board of Education Regulation?
1. Were there relevant behaviors noted during observation in regular education classroom settings?
2. Are there educationally relevant medical findings?

MultiSelectField.Label: 3. The following have been ruled out as primary causes for the eligibility decision:

FlagField.Label: 4. Does this decision reflect each member’s conclusion?

Layout.Text: The need for ESY is to be decided individually. Therefore, an LEA must not have a policy that no ESY services will be provided, that they are only available to a certain group or age of children, or that services are only provided for a set amount of time or a specified number of days. Personnel providing ESY services should meet the same requirements that apply to personnel providing the same types of services as a part of a regular school program.

FlagField.Label: Is a significant regression anticipated if ESY services are not provided?

TextField.Label: Describe the nature of the student's regression

FlagField.Label: Does the nature and severity of the student's disability impact the maintenance of attained skills?

TextField.Label: Describe how the student's disability impacts the maintenance of attained skills

FlagField.Label: Is the student at a critical point in instruction (e.g., emerging skill, transition point, etc.) such that continued specialized instruction and related services, without a break, is crucial to the student's educational program?

TextField.Label: Describe the critical point in instruction

FlagField.Label: Are there any special circumstances, such as a large number of absences during the school year, that are relevant to consideration of ESY?

MultiSelectField.Label: The IEP team used the following information and data in determining the need for ESY services:

Option.Label: Teacher assessment of the student's success with various instructional interventions
Health and health-related factors, including physical and social/emotional functioning
Past educational history, as appropriate, including any ESY services
Direct observation of the student's classroom performance
Parent interviews and student interviews where appropriate

FlagField.Label: Did the IEP Team determine that the student will require ESY services?

b.em: Complete this section if the student will be receiving ESY Services.

TextField.Label: Document information from a variety of sources including data in all areas related to the student's suspected disability.
Document information from a variety of sources including data in all areas related to the student's suspected disability:

div.style: border: 1px solid #EEE; background-color: #F7FAF9; font-size: 8pt; font-color: #AAADAD; padding: 10px;
div.em:
Guidance Tip
If the evaluation will include more areas than the FBA:
Return to student's programs tab and complete a Consent for Evaluation action
Select all evaluation areas (be sure to include Functional Behavioral assessment)
Choose the 'Consent for Evaluation' option below and record the date consent was received

FlagField.Label: Was consent granted?

TextField.Label: Describe the student's typical behavior in all education related settings (e.g., his/her approach to tasks, expectations, supervision, interaction, directives, etc.). Describe the events necessitating an FBA at this time.

Option.Label: Records Review (permanent record, special education record)
Samples of Behavior (direct observations of frequency, rate, latency, duration, etc.)

TextField.Label: Describe the data collected for this assessment, including the strategies implemented and the results.

Based on the data and findings, formulate a hypothesis regarding the function the target behavior serves for the student (e.g., Given [setting] and [antecedents], the student is likely to [target behavior] in order to [function])

Describe expected behavior(s) for all students where problem behavior(s) occurs and describe the reinforcement(s) available to all students who participate in them successfully. The description should include: (1) how successful students get attention, interact, follow procedures, respond to others, etc.; and (2) specific reinforcement, acknowledgement, tokens, praise, privileges, class rewards, recognition etc. available to all students.
Possible Strategies to Support and Reinforce Replacement Behavior(s):
Specific Instruction for accommodations and/or modifications:

div.style: border: 1px solid #EEE; background-color: #F7FAF9; font-size: 8pt; font-color: #AAADAD; padding: 10px;
div.em:
SCDE Guidance Tip:
IEPs can be amended without convening an IEP Team meeting by agreement between the parent/guardian and LEA. If an IEP amendment will be made with a meeting, please create an ad hoc meeting from the program tab.

FlagField.Label: Will a meeting be held to amend the IEP?

DateField.Label: Date parent contacted regarding agreement to amend:

TextField.Label: Which section(s) on the current IEP will be amended?
Description of the action that the school district proposes or refuses to take:
Explanation of why the school district/agency proposes or refuses to take this action:
Description of other choices the school district/agency considered and the reasons why those choices were rejected:
Description of each evaluation procedure, assessment, record, or report the school district/agency used/will use as a basis for the proposed or refused action:
Description of any other factors relevant to the school district/agency proposal or refusal:
Sources (outside agencies or organizations) that parents may contact to obtain assistance in understanding the IEP or IEP process

FlagField.Label: Will the child participate in alternate assessment instead of general assessment?

TextField.Label: Explain why the student cannot participate in the general assessment and why the particular assessment is appropriate.

Option.Label: P - Substitution of objects for pictures

FlagField.Label: Was oral administration provided as an accommodation?

TextField.Label: Explain why the IEP team determined that oral administration was necessary and list all data reviewed to support this decision.

FlagField.Label: Was non-standard selected for any assessment(s)?

TextField.Label: List all the accommodations that will be provided. For each non-standard accommodation, explain why the accommodation is necessary for the student to access the assessment.

FlagField.Label: Did the IEP team determine that the student requires ESY services?

InputArea.Label: Please indicate in the Goals and Services sections above whether or not the goal or services will be covered/provided in ESY.

SingleSelectField.Label: Select the placement option that best describes the student's placement for the program developed by the IEP team:

MultiSelectField.Label: Identify how the student's instruction in core content areas (ELA, Math, Science and Social Studies) will be delivered by checking the delivery models that will be used (check all that apply).

Option.Label: Regular instruction in the general education classroom
Co-teaching with general education and special education teachers
Specialized instruction that supplements general education instruction
Specially designed instruction in core academic area(s)

TextField.Label: Describe any specific directions relating to the student's placement or the delivery of instruction and services:

InputArea.Label: Check the academic areas and nonacademic activities where the student will not participate with nondisabled students:

TextField.Label: If Schedule to be determined is checked: The regular classes and activities in which the student will not participate may vary based on scheduling needs but will likely include all or part of the following regular classes/activities:

Text.em: NOTE: If 'Schedule to be determined' is checked, student will continue to participate in the required number of minutes for all required subject areas.

TextField.Label: Removal Justification - If the student is removed from general education for any part of the school day, explain why the students is being removed

Text.Strong: The IEP Meeting has been held; the names listed here as Meeting Participants accurately reflects those in attendance and will print to the IEP document.

Section.Label: Requires the following transportation modification(s) and/or support(s) as a relegated service:

Option.Label: To proactively address behavior that may affect access to the special education program
To decrease exposure to traffic (i.e. provide an alternate area for pick-up and drop-off)
To provide for the medical needs of the student in order to access the special education program

MultiSelectField.Label: Modification of Pick Up and/or Drop Off Location

Option.Label: Pick up and Drop off on residence side
Pick up and Drop off requires smooth surface to access lift
Pick up and Drop off at school entrance (which allow for less congestion or more supervision or support)
Seating at front of bus passenger loading door side
Seating away from front entry door or rear windows
Seating with peer in aisle to cue student to stay in seat
Seated over wheel well (need additional extremity support)

FlagField.Label: Does the IEP contain a measurable annual goal directly related to the student's required need for transportation as a related service?
Does the IEP contain a Functional Behavior Assessment and a Behavior Intervention Plan that proactively addresses behaviors that may occur during transportation?
Can student be unloaded from the bus without an adult awaiting to assist him/her.
Does the student require supervision and/or assistance?

Option.Label: To avoid contract with emergency window and door exits
To board the bus using steps
To demonstrate the required behavior for riding the school bus in a safe manner
To remain seated in an upright position either on the seat or within the compartment
To cross the street and safely navigate into the home
To avoid hazardous areas near a bus stop location
To remain safe in danger zone
To cross the street and safely navigate into the school
To exit bus in the event of an emergency
To avoid putting anything out the windows

FlagField.Label: Does the student require the use of specialized equipment?

Option.Label: Non-latex gloves (for students with allergy to latex)
Left sustaining equipment (i.e. oxygen, ventilator, suctioning devices, protective gear)
Oversize wheelchair or a wheelchair that requires high bus entrance lift door

FlagField.Label: Does the student have any medical requirements?

Option.Label: Fragile bones or other orthopedic condition precautions
Medication side effects (i.e. falls asleep easily, sensitive to sunlight, etc.)
Special staff assistance (aide, nurse, shadow, etc.)

TextField.Label: For any of the medical requirements selected above, provide specifics:

FlagField.Label: Is personnel training for modifying and monitoring, to include procedures for monitoring the measureable annual goal related to transportation and /or implementing a Behavior Intervention Plan, necessary to implement this Transportation Plan?

TextField.Label: Description of training and participants necessary to be trained.

Section.Label: Relevant Information

DateField.Label: Date parent provided a copy of Procedural Safeguards (should be same as parent notification date)

FlagField.Label: Was a functional behavioral assessment conducted prior to the date of this incident?
Does student have an existing behavioral intervention plan?

DateField.Label: Date of Last Modification of existing BIP

FlagField.Label: Does the behavioral intervention plan include a crisis plan?

Section.Text: A review of relevant information in the student's file, including the student's IEP, teacher observations, and any relevant information must be completed to determine whether student's conduct was the direct result of the student's disability or a failure of the administrative unit or state operated program to implement the IEP.

Column.Text: Date of Special Education Referral (if applicable):

TextField.Label: Describe in detail the incident resulting in disciplinary action:

FlagField.Label: Was the violation of the student code of conduct associated with one or more of the special circumstances (weapons, drugs, serious bodily injury)?

TextField.Label: Additional Description of Documents and/or Other Relevant Information Considered:

FlagField.Label: Was the conduct in question caused by, or directly and substantially related to, the student's disability?
Was the conduct in question a direct result of the LEA's failure to implement the IEP?
Is the behavior a manifestation of the student's disability? (were either or both marked yes)

InputArea.Label: Describe the actions and processes to follow the manifestation determination

FlagField.Label: Student will return to placement from which he/she was removed
Student will remain in interim alternative educational setting (IAES) until [date]
Parent and LEA have agreed to a change of placement
IEP team meeting will be held on [date] at [time]
Conduct FBA and develop a BIP
Review/revise FBA and BIP
Discipline or expulsion hearing scheduled for [date] at [time]
Other

TextField.Label: Description of the action that the school district proposes or refuses to take:
Explanation of why the school district/agency proposes or refuses to take this action:
Description of other choices the school district/agency considered and the reasons why those choices were rejected:
Description of each evaluation procedure, assessment, record, or report the school district/agency used/will use as a basis for the proposed or refused action:
Description of any other factors relevant to the school district/agency proposal or refusal:
Sources (outside agencies or organizations) that parents may contact to obtain assistance in understanding the IEP or IEP process:

FlagField.Label: Will there be any enclosures?

Column.Text: Date parent provided with Prior Written Notice:

DateField.Label: Date parent provided with Prior Written Notice:

Text.Strong: Invite all guardians with a single meeting notice.

FlagField.Label: Are there additional items to be discussed?

Option.Label: Phone: Left Message *(This is not one of the required 2 varied attempts.)

FlagField.Label: Parent response received?

DateField.Label: Date of rescheduled meeting (reflect meeting date change on notice above)

FlagField.Label: Did parent request accommodations?
Were alternative methods of participation offered (eg. phone)?

SingleSelectField.Label: The IEP Team has determined that the following will occur at the end of this semester:

Option.Label: The student will graduate with a regular high school diploma
The student will turn 21 years of age during this semester

DateField.Label: Graduation Date
DateField.ShowIf: Occur='The student will graduate with a regular high school diploma'

TextField.Label: The termination of special education services is based on the following records and reports:
TextField.ShowIf: Occur='The student will graduate with a regular high school diploma'

TextField.Label: Other options considered and reasons rejected were:
TextField.ShowIf: Occur='The student will graduate with a regular high school diploma'

TextField.Label: Other factors considered were:
TextField.ShowIf: Occur='The student will graduate with a regular high school diploma'

UserField.Label: Person sending the graduation notice
UserField.ShowIf: Occur='The student will graduate with a regular high school diploma'

Section.Label: Contact person if Parent/Guardian has questions

FlagField.Label: Has the student reached age of majority (and not been conserved)?

b.em: *Note: Outside Agency Permission document is only necessary if 'Yes' is selected

FlagField.Label: Should an outside agency be invited to the meeting?

InputArea.Label: *Remember to provide the Outside Agency Permission form to the parent/student with the meeting notice

DateField.Label: When should the permission be returned by?

Text.Strong: Invite all guardians with a single meeting notice.

FlagField.Label: Are there additional items to be discussed?

Option.Label: Phone: Left Message *(This is not one of the required 2 varied attempts.)

FlagField.Label: Parent response received?

DateField.Label: Date of rescheduled meeting (reflect meeting date change on notice above)

FlagField.Label: Did parent request accommodations?

TextField.Label: What alternative methods of participation were offered (eg. phone)?

Template.Name: Part C to Part B Transition

DateField.Label: Date of Part C Transition Conference:

Option.Label: Arts, A/V Technology and Communications Designing
Law, Public Safety, Corrections and Security
Standard Middle School Course of Study
Standard Course of Study towards a state high school diploma
Standard Course of Study towards a GED
Functional Academic and Occupational Course of Study

TextField.Label: Recommended courses to support post-secondary transition

SingleSelectField.Label: High School Projected Outcome - To be determined prior to entry into 9th grade

Text.h3: Transition services needed to assist student in reaching post-secondary goals

Section.Label: Age of Majority
Section.Text: If the student will be turning 17 during the term of this IEP, a Notice of Transfer of Rights at Age of Majority will be included as the last page of the student's IEP. During the IEP team meeting (or following the meeting if necessary), school staff must ensure that the notice is received by both the student and the parent and offer to provide additional explanation or clarification to the student and/or parent.

FlagField.Label: Will the student turn 17 years of age during the term of this IEP?

TextField.Label: What are the student's academic and functional strengths?
What are the student's academic and functional needs?
How does the student's disability affect his/her involvement and progress in general curriculum?
What are the student's pre-academic, social/emotional, and functional strengths?
What are the student's pre-academic, social/emotional, and functional needs?
How does the student's disability affect his/her involvement in age appropriate activites?
Description of the action that the school district proposes or refuses to take:
Explanation of why the school district/agency proposes or refuses to take this action:
Description of other choices the school district/agency considered and the reasons why those choices were rejected:
Description of each evaluation procedure, assessment, record, or report the school district/agency used/will use as a basis for the proposed or refused action:
Description of any other factors relevant to the school district/agency proposal or refusal:
Sources (outside agencies or organizations) that parents may contact to obtain assistance in understanding the IEP or IEP process:

InputArea.Label: If parent/guardian did not attend meeting, or this is an amendment, a copy of the IEP must be sent with the PWN.

FlagField.Label: Will there be any enclosures?

TextField.Label: Progress Report (Describe how parents will be informed of the student's progress towards goals and how freqently this will occur.)

Section.Label: Determination Regarding Additional Data

MultiSelectField.Label: Indicate the information that was reviewed in determining whether additional data is needed:

Option.Label: Observations of teachers and related service providers
The current IEP, including PLAAFP and goals

FlagField.Label: Is additional information needed?

MultiSelectField.Label: Additional information is needed to determine:

Option.Label: whether the child continues to be a child with a disability
the current educational needs of the child
the present levels of academic achievement and functional performance
whether any additions or modifications to the special education and related services are needed

InputArea.Label: The action proposed (to conduct a reeval) is included on print document along with reasons for accepting or rejecting proposal and information considered.

TextField.Label: Description of other choices the school district/agency considered and the reasons why those choices were rejected
Description of any other factors relevant to the school district/agency proposal of refusal
Sources (outside agencies or organizations) that parents may contact to obtain assistance in understanding the IEP or IEP process

Section.Label: Consent Indication

InputArea.Label: This permission shall be valid for the following duration.

MultiSelectField.Label: Consent indicated for following records/information to be released or secured

Section.Text: All information released or secured will be in compliance with the Family Education Rights and Privacy Act and applicable South Carolina law. No additional information will be released or secured without prior approval from the parent, except as provided by law.

Section.Label: Return Consent for Release Confidential Info to:

SingleSelectField.Label: Consent for Release of Confidential Info was

DateField.Label: Consent for Release of Confidential Info was received

TextField.Label: Optional: Additional information about revocation (will not print to document)
Describe any specific requirements or instructions for transportation services:
Describe any specific directions, considerations, or delivery methods for special education, other related services, and supplementary aids and services:

Review of Medical Information/Records (Describe any medical concerns currently impacting the student; consider whether the student has any medical diagnoses, is currently taking medication, or currently using any assistive technology devices):

Pre-referral Interventions (Briefly describe/attach current or past interventions/programs/services provided to the child, such as amount of time in a Tier Intervention, preschool experiences, OT/PT, other early interventions, and results):
Other Relevant Information (Describe any other relevant information from the parent, school, other agencies, etc):
This recommendation is based on the following considerations:
We decided against these options because:
Any other factors considered by the team:
Sources (outside agencies or organizations) that parents may contact to obtain assistance in understanding the IEP or IEP process:

FlagField.Label: Will there be any enclosures?
1. Were there relevant behaviors noted during observation in regular education classroom settings?

TextField.Label: If yes, describe how such behavior affects the student's academic functioning:

FlagField.Label: 2. Are there any educationally relevant medical findings?

MultiSelectField.Label: 3. The following have been ruled out as primary causes for the eligibility decision

FlagField.Label: 4. Does this decision reflect each member's conclusion?

TextField.Label: If no, document the decision of those members (including member names):
Describe any differences between the program that will be provided by the new LEA and the IEP from the prior LEA. Include any differences in the goals, services, LRE or assessment participation.

UserField.Label: Who should the student contact if he/she has questions about the IEP meeting?

FlagField.Label: Did the student participate in the meeting?
Did the student participate in the IEP Meeting?

TextField.Label: Describe the steps taken to ensure that the student's preferences and interests were considered.

Section.Label: Part 1: Student Information
Section.Text: Complete and up-to-date information is critical.

UserField.Label: Name of Person completing this Form

TextField.Label: To obtain a copy of transcripts, contact the school guidance office at:
To obtain copies of special education documentation, contact the Office of Special Education at:

List student documentation attached to and provided with this summary (important documentation might include: most recent IEP, assessment documentation, psychological reports, aptitude results, interest inventories... any documentation related to eligibility or associated with attainment of post high school goals).

InputArea.Label: These goals should indicate the Post-Secondary environment(s) the student intends to transition to upon completion of high school.

Section.Label: Part 3: Summary of Performance
Section.Text: This section includes three critical areas: Academic, Cognitive, and Functional levels of performance. Where applicable and based on age-appropriate abilities, assessment, and the student's post high school goals. Indicate the level of Academic Achievement and Cognitive Performance in the following areas by selecting 'Yes' if it's an Area of Strength or 'No' for an Area of Limitation. Provide supporting details of the Current Level of Performance (strengths, needs, and grade level assessment summary)

FlagField.Label: Reading (Basic reading/decoding, reading comprehension, fluency, speed, and vocabulary)
Math (Calculation skills, problem solving; quantitative reasoning)
Written Language (composition, expression, spelling, grammar, and semantics)
Learning Styles and Needs (class participation, note taking, keyboarding, organization, self management, time management, study skills, test-taking skills)
General Ability and Problem Solving (reasoning/processing)
Attention and Executive Functioning (energy level, sustained attention, memory functions, processing speed, impulse control, activity level)
Communication (speech/language, assisted communication)

TextField.Label: Essential accommodations/modifications and or assistive technology utilized and why needed.

InputArea.Label: FUNCTIONAL AREAS: Describe the functional capacities and how they may relate to post high school performance in work, community, or educational settings.

FlagField.Label: Social / Interpersonal Behavior or Skills (Interactions with others, emotional or behavioral issues related to learning and/or attention)
Independent Living Skills (Self-care, leisure skills, personal safety, personal hygiene, transportation, banking, budgeting)
Environmental Access/Mobility (Assistive technology, mobility, transportation, or other special accommodations)
Self Determination and Advocacy (Ability to identify and articulate learning strengths and needs, ability to ask for assistance with learning and independence)

Self Direction (Ability to follow and understand directions (written or verbal), complete tasks, work independently, ask for assistance when necessary, use feedback to improve or correct work performance, initiate work activity)
Career –Vocational Transition/Employment (Career interests, career exploration, job-training, employment experiences and supports)
Work Tolerance and Work Skills (Capacity to meet the physical and psychological demands of work and to learn and perform job tasks)

TextField.Label: Additional important information and considerations that can assist in making decisions about disability determination and needed accommodations (e.g., medical problems, family concerns)

Section.Label: Part 4: Recommendations to assist the student in meeting postsecondary goals

Text.Strong: This section presents recommendations to the student, family and others utilizing this form for essential accommodations, adaptive devices, assistive services, compensatory strategies, and/or support services, to enhance access and participation in post high school environment, including higher education, training, employment, independent living and/or community participation.

p.Strong: (These recommendations do not obligate any post high school agency to such recommendations)

p.strong: For each postsecondary goal, explain recommendations for meeting them and include any agency contact information, Title, Phone Number, Address, or Email (include both agencies currently contacted and those that may need to be contacted)

TextField.Label: Higher Education or Career-Technical Education Recommendations

FlagField.Label: Does Independent Living apply for the student?

Section.Label: Part 5: Student Input (Recommended/Supplemental Information)

FlagField.Label: Is student willing to be contacted via social media to obtain postsecondary information?
Student has been notified that one year after leaving high school, that they will be contacted to complete a survey regarding their postsecondary activities?

Section.Text: Review these questions with the student prior to completion of the Summary of Performance. (Questions may be read to the student and written by teacher as accommodation if necessary).

MultiSelectField.Label: A. How or in which area(s) does your disability affect your schoolwork and school activities such as: (check all that apply)

TextField.Label: Please describe how these areas are affected (both positive and negative):

MultiSelectField.Label: B. What supports or accommodations have helped you to succeed in school? (check all that apply)

TextField.Label: C. What supports or accommodations do you feel you will need to achieve your goals after high school?

D. If you believe that you will need services, supports, programs, or accommodations, have you and your family made a connection with the agencies (other than your current school) that can help you with these needs?
Will you need help to obtain any needed services, supports, programs, or accommodations after you leave high school?
E. What strengths and needs should future employers or teachers know about you as you enter the college or work environment?

div.style: border: 1px solid #EEE; background-color: #F7FAF9; font-size: 8pt; font-color: #AAADAD; padding: 10px;

em.strong: Summer school is a general education program and is not provided as part of the individualized education program for a student with a disability. However, students with disabilities, like any other students, may participate in summer school. Whether the student will participate in summer school is a decision to be made by the parent and student in consultation with the student's school. If a student is going to participate in summer school, it is important to document what accommodations and modifications, if any, will be provided for the student during summer school.

TextField.Label: Describe the accommodations, if any, that will be provided during summer school:
Describe the modifications, if any, that will be provided during summer school:

FlagField.Label: Has a copy of the evaluation report been provided to the parent(s)?

UserField.Label: Who provided a copy of the evaluation report to the parent(s) and on what date?

Section.Label: The multi-disciplinary team determination
Section.Text: The IEP Team has summarized all required screening and evaluation information including a discussion of the student's strengths and needs on the evaluation/eligibility worksheet(s).

InputArea.Label: Based on information from a variety of sources that have been documented and carefully considered, the IEP Team has determined:

FlagField.Label: The student meets criteria for one or more of the disabling conditions;
The disability has an adverse effect on educational performance; and
The disability requires specially designed instruction.

Text.em: Note: All three must be yes in order for the student to be eligible for special education and related services.

InputArea.Label: The IEP Team has also concluded:

FlagField.Label: The determination is not the result of lack of appropriate instruction in reading, including the essential components of reading instruction. The term 'essential components of reading instruction' means explicit and systematic instruction in: phonemic awareness, phonics, vocabulary development, reading fluency (including oral reading skills), and reading comprehension strategies.
The determination is not the result of lack of appropriate instruction in math; and
The determination is not the result of Limited English proficiency of the student.

Text.em: Note: All three must be yes in order for the student to be eligible for special education and related services.

TextField.Label: Description of the action that the school district proposes or refuses to take:
Explanation of why the school district/agency proposes or refuses to take this action:
Description of other choices the school district/agency considered and the reasons why those choices were rejected:
Description of each evaluation procedure, assessment, record, or report the school district/agency used/will use as a basis for the proposed or refused action:
Description of any other factors relevant to the school district/agency proposal or refusal:
Sources (outside agencies or organizations) that parents may contact to obtain assistance in understanding the IEP or IEP process:

FlagField.Label: Will there be any enclosures?

SingleSelectField.Label: Is the member's area of curriculum or related service likely to be modified or discussed?
How much time will the team member be unable to attend the meeting?

TextField.Label: The educational concerns I have about this student are:
The student's present levels of achievement and functional performance are:
The student still needs to work on:
The accommodations, modifications and/or specialized instruction that will assist your child in accessing the general curriculum are:

Section.Label: Return IEP Team Member Excusal to:

FlagField.Label: Do you want to print the contact log on the document?

DateField.Label: Date IEP Team Member Excusal received

Section.Label: Determination Regarding Additional Data
Section.Text: When a student transfers into an LEA, the LEA must determine next steps to serve the student. First, the LEA must determine if additional information is needed to determine eligibility and/or to develop an IEP in the new LEA.

MultiSelectField.Label: Indicate the information that was reviewed in determining whether additional data is needed:

Option.Label: Observations of teachers and related service providers
The current IEP, including PLAAFP and goals

FlagField.Label: Is additional information needed?

MultiSelectField.Label: Additional information is needed to determine:

Option.Label: whether the child continues to be a child with a disability
the current educational needs of the child
the present levels of academic achievement and functional performance
whether any additions or modifications to the special education and related services are needed

InputArea.Label: The action proposed (to conduct a reeval) is included on print document along with reasons for accepting or rejecting proposal and information considered.

TextField.Label: Description of other choices the school district/agency considered and the reasons why those choices were rejected
Description of any other factors relevant to the school district/agency proposal of refusal
Sources (outside agencies or organizations) that parents may contact to obtain assistance in understanding the IEP or IEP process

Text.b: Put in the date of the most recent reevaluation review IEP / eligibility determination.
